column4: this also happens on the live USB of xubuntu and lubuntu. i bet it will happen with any linux distro
this seems to be related to graphics
whenever I'm running a 3D app with high FPS the sound is high pitched. lower FPS = lower pitched, more chainsaw-like
(both nouveau and nvidia driver do that)
if you unplug the headphones and speakers, do you still hear it?
yes
the computer itself plays the sound..
have you tried momentarily stopping the fan on the video card
it's not the GPU fan...
definitely not
Okay, then I think i know exactly what your talking about
some people are able to hear the pwm through an inductor when the varnish on the inductor has started to fail. This could be an indicator of other issues (why did the varnish fail, did it overheat)
hunt around and see if you can pin the noise to your powersupply (likely culprit), otherwise you might be looking at a slowly dieing videocard :(
this issue happens since always (my computer is 9 months old)
it can, whenever i hear it i return the item
maybe i should try to plug stuff again, yes
i'll look into it later
I had a brand new samsung that I took back, I could hear it hum when i set the brightness to anoything below 80 :D
prime95 on windows is usally my go-to powersupply torture test
looks like there is a prime95 for linux, try that out in torture test mode, the one that stresses powersupply
http://www.mersenne.org/freesoft/
